title: prysm v3.2.1 crashes soon after start
body:
# üêû Bug Report

### Description

prysm crashes around 1 minute after start up.

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

v3.2.0 was functioning ok. It has crashed before in January, but I was able to recover. I restarted prysm today and it upgraded to v3.2.1 and then crashed. Restarting crashes almost immediately.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

prysm.bat beacon-chain --config-file=config.yaml

config.yaml contents:
datadir: 'C:\path\to\prysm\data'
http-web3provider: '//./pipe/geth.ipc'
log-file: 'prysm.log'

## üî• Error

<pre><code>


c:\path\to\prysm>prysm.bat beacon-chain --config-file=config.yaml 
A subdirectory or file c:\path\to\prysm\dist already exists.
[37mLatest prysm release is v3.2.1.[0m
Using prysm version v3.2.1.
[32mBeacon chain is up to date.[0m
[33mWARN GPG verification is not natively available on Windows.[0m
[33mWARN Skipping integrity verification of downloaded binary[0m
[37mVerifying binary authenticity with SHA256 Hash.[0m
[32mSHA256 Hash Match[0m

## üåç  Your Environment

**Operating System:**

<pre>
  <code>
Windows 10. 256GB ECC RAM. AMD Ryzen Threadripper PRO 3945WX
  </code>
</pre>

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

<pre>
  <code>
v3.2.1
  </code>
</pre>

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**

The system has over 100GB RAM free at time of crash. So I don't see why the error is "fatal error: out of memory". Watching the process is doesn't even get to 2GB in size before crashing.

I've been able to get running again with:
`
set USE_PRYSM_VERSION=v3.2.0
`
After a clean shutdown and reboot I reattempted the newer version and it appears to be working now.

That is pretty unusual, its the first time I have seen such an error for Prysm. The only other case I could find was here:
https://github.com/golang/go/issues/37029 . Although in your case it appears that you have much more memory free than the required amount
closing this issue now that the user reported that it appears to be working.
